001package edu.cnm.deepdive.leavemealone.controller;
002
003import android.app.Dialog;
004import android.os.Bundle;
005import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
006import androidx.annotation.Nullable;
007import androidx.appcompat.app.AlertDialog;
008import androidx.appcompat.app.AlertDialog.Builder;
009import androidx.fragment.app.DialogFragment;
010import androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner;
011import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelProvider;
012import dagger.hilt.android.AndroidEntryPoint;
013import edu.cnm.deepdive.leavemealone.R;
014import edu.cnm.deepdive.leavemealone.viewmodel.LocationViewModel;
015
016/**
017 * This dialog allows for locations to be set with the marker for secure or unsecure
018 */
019@AndroidEntryPoint
020public class CoordinatesDialogFragment extends DialogFragment{
021
022  private LocationViewModel viewModel;
023
024  @NonNull
025  @Override
026  public Dialog onCreateDialog(@Nullable Bundle savedInstanceState) {
027    return new Builder(requireContext())
028        .setTitle(R.string.dialog_title)
029        .setMessage(R.string.dialog_message)
030        .setPositiveButton(R.string.set_secure_label, (dlg, which) -> {
031          viewModel.markLocation(true);
032        })
033        .setNegativeButton(R.string.set_unsecure_label, (dlg, which) -> {
034          viewModel.markLocation(false);
035        })
036        .setNeutralButton(android.R.string.cancel, (dlg, which) -> {
037        })
038        .create();
039  }
040
041  @Override
042  public void onStart() {
043    super.onStart();
044    ViewModelProvider provider = new ViewModelProvider(requireActivity());
045    viewModel = provider.get(LocationViewModel.class);
046  }
047}
